page.title: 15CHILDHOOD MEMORIES 1910-20 2
page.content: Soldiers from barracks paraded to church on Sundays led by antelope,regimental mascot, and band. Played popular tunes on way back. Military funerals held in churchyard Volleys fired over graves.Afterwards scramble by the boys to find empty cartridge cases to play with.Day after a villager died biggest Church bell would be rung,once for a man,twice for a woman.Then age would be tolled.The children enjoyed counting rings to find age.If Lord and Lady Dormer came through the village children had to run to the side of the road and bow or curtsey.Each house had 1 or 2 pigs in the back garden 'Bodger'Hall(Ena's father who was a butcher before he became a shepherd)used to kill them When the children heard the squeals they raced there.The first got inflated bladder tied to a stick.
